1. Analyze product structures - KC1.question: When can you create precise assemblies in Active Workspace?
options: If we apply the Latest Working revision rule
If we apply the Precise Only revision rule
Editing values in the Precise column
Precise assemblies can be viewed, but not created in Active Worskpace
1. Analyze product structures - KC1.correct: Editing values in the Precise column

1. Analyze product structures - KC1.question: For a component that has only revision A, approved, and revision B, working, the Latest Working revision rule would select which of the following?
When we open an assembly, what happens?
options: The global revision rule will be applied if we open it for the first time
The assembly will not load any revisions and wait for us to manually select a revision rule
The assembly will always be loaded using the Latest Working revision rule, but we can change that later on
The assembly will always be loaded using the Any Status; Working revision rule, but we can change that later on
1. Analyze product structures - KC1.correct: The global revision rule will be applied if we open it for the first time

1. Analyze product structures - KC1.question: A working context contains what?
options: Just one assembly and one revision rule

1. Analyze product structures - KC1.question: Imprecise structures need to be configured using a revision rule.
Working contexts are always visible to everyone.
We can compare two revisions of the same item.
We can choose to compare only the leaf nodes of our assembly.

A workflow process can have any number of tasks arranged how?
When initiating a new process, how do you know which process template to assign?
options: Assign based on the number of signoffs required.
Assign based on the amount of time available to complete the process.

options: Always assigned a release status when the process is complete.
Provide information to those performing tasks.
Are never assigned a status change when the process completes.

options: Double click to open the file
Download the file and replace it after the changes

1. Create and edit product structures -.question: Files stored in Active Workspace are linked to other workspace objects with _____
What kind of queries cannot we use to find components within an assembly?
Which of the statements below is true?
options: Selecting our search results highlights them in the 3D view
The “Show only results in Viewer” button shows everything but the results in the 3D view
The assembly queries search the first level of the assembly only
If an item is used several times in an assembly, the search results will list it just once
1. Create and edit product structures -.correct: Selecting our search results highlights them in the 3D view

1. Create and edit product structures -.question: The Where Used tab shows us what?
options: The top level assemblies that use the current item
The immediate BOM parents of the current item
The bottom level assemblies that use the current item
1. Create and edit product structures -.correct: The immediate BOM parents of the current item

options: This filtering can be based on object type
This filtering can be based on relation type

options: Assign based on the number of signoffs required
Assign based on the amount of time available to complete the process
Assign based on the order of templates in the list

options: Assigned a release status when the process is complete
Provide information to those performing tasks
Are not assigned a status change when the process completes

1. Initiate a workflow.question: Which of the following is not true regarding a workflow process?
options: Tasks can be arranged in serial progression
Tasks can be arranged in parallel progression
Must be performed by person creating the workflow
Can have any number of tasks
1. Initiate a workflow.correct: Must be performed by person creating the workflow

1. Managing workflow processes.question: What do resource pools allow you to do?

Identify a group of users who will not participate in workflow tasks
Define a group of resources who have permissions to update an item
Balance workflow task assignments across many team members
1. Managing workflow processes.correct: Balance workflow task assignments across many team members

Task assignments that matches their role
Task assignments that matches their group and role

1. Selecting signoff teams.question: What are the valid clipping side options?
When can you assign a signoff team to perform the signoff for each review task in the process you start a new workflow process?
options: Only when you start the workflow process
Only during the review task step
Only at the start of the workflow process or during the workflow process
Only when you are asked to assign a reviewer
1. Selecting signoff teams.correct: Only at the start of the workflow process or during the workflow process

1. Selecting signoff teams.question: A signoff team can be any of these except?
options: Leaving the field empty to skip the signoff

options: Do task, Review task and Acknowledge task

1. Selecting signoff teams.question: Who assigns the signoff teams?
options: By the workflow initiator after a workflow is started.
By the workflow initiator before a workflow is started.
By the workflow reviewer after a workflow is started.
By the workflow participant after a workflow is started.
1. Selecting signoff teams.correct: By the workflow initiator after a workflow is started.

Distribution lists associated with workflow process templates

Users can have different Roles and Groups

The Release Status of the item to be submitted must be Production
The Release Status of the item to be submitted must be Development
The Item to be submitted hould have file attachments
1. Working with standard workflows.correct: The Release Status of the item to be submitted must be Empty

1. Working with standard workflows.question: Which of the following is a prerequiste for performing a Production Release Process in Teamcenter?
options: The Release Status of the item to be submitted must be Empty
The Release Status of the item to be submitted must be Production
The Release Status of the item to be submitted must be Development
The Item to be submitted hould have file attachments

Where can Product Structures can be modified?
options: Using either Active Workspace or CAD software
2. Create and edit product structures -.correct: Using either Active Workspace or CAD software

2. Create and edit product structures -.question: When can you add a child to a bill of materials?
options: Only if the child item is already in our clipboard
Even if it doesn’t exist yet: create item and add to BOM can be performed in a single action
If we have write access to the toplevel assembly
If we have write access to its top level parent
2. Create and edit product structures -.correct: Even if it doesn’t exist yet: create item and add to BOM can be performed in a single action

2. Create and edit product structures -.question: The Add Sibling option add a child item where?
options: To the parent of the selected assembly level
2. Create and edit product structures -.correct: To the parent of the selected assembly level

2. Create and edit product structures -.question: The Add Sibling option appears when?
options: Isn’t shown unless we have read access to the selected item
Isn’t shown unless we have selected a child item in the context of an assembly
Isn’t shown unless we have write access to the selected item
2. Create and edit product structures -.correct: Isn’t shown unless we have selected a child item in the context of an assembly

2. Create and edit product structures -.question: Which of the following are occurrence properties?
When can we edit the quantity of a given level?
options: If we have write access to that assembly level
If we have write access to the parent of that assembly level
If we have write access to both that assembly level and its parent
Regardless of our write access to either the assembly level or its parent
2. Create and edit product structures -.correct: If we have write access to the parent of that assembly level

2.2. Create and revise items.question: In order to create an Item, the user must follow a sequence. Which sequence is correct?
options: Select a Folder, click Add, choose the Type, enter the information, click Add
Select a Folder, click Create, choose the Type, enter the information, click Finish
Select a Folder, click Add, choose the Type, enter the information, click Finish
2.2. Create and revise items.correct: Select a Folder, click Add, choose the Type, enter the information, click Add

2.3. Create and edit a file.question: In order to revise an item, the user must follow a sequence. Which sequence is correct?
options: Select Save As or Revise, click New, enter the information, click Save
Select Revise, click New, enter the information, click Save
Select Revise, enter the information, click Save
Select Save As or Revise, enter the information, click Save
2.3. Create and edit a file.correct: Select Save As or Revise, enter the information, click Save

Download the file and Replace it after the changes from the Primary Toolbar

Select a File from Attachments and select Edit>Start Edit from the Primary Toolbar
Open a File from Attachments and select Edit>Checkout from the Primary Toolbar
Select a File from Attachments and select Edit>Checkout from the Primary Toolbar
2.4. Save search criteria and export sea.correct: Select the file then Edit from the Primary Toolbar

Your Recent Searches and your saved search

options: Pin it to the home page

2.4. Save search criteria and export sea.correct: Home page or the Saved page of the Search page header

2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.question: Users can delete saved searches that are shared with them.
Which of these item types are typically organized in assemblies?
Check the statement below that are true.
options: An assembly has exactly three levels: toplevel, intermediate level and leaf node
The same item can be used several times within an assembly
One assembly level can be at the same time a parent and a child level
2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.correct: The same item can be used several times within an assembly

2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.question: An item that has a bill of materials is:
What of the following statements is true regarding the expand command when we use the table view mode?
options: When I open a structure for the first time, I see only the first of its levels
If I choose to expand all levels when a subassembly is selected, it will expand all levels of the toplevel assembly
If I choose to expand all levels when a subassembly is selected, it will expand all levels of the selected subassembly
The expand command can be applied in table view mode
2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.correct: When I open a structure for the first time, I see only the first of its levels

2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.question: What of the following conditions are needed for two levels to be packed together?
options: Both levels should have the same item id
Both levels should have different find number
Both levels should have the same quantity of that item
2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.correct: Both levels should have the same item id

2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.question: When we load a structure in a split screen, the summary tab on the right:
options: Will always load the information for the selected level on the left
Will always load the information for the toplevel assembly
Lets us edit the information for the assembly components
Lets us view information for the assembly components, but not edit it
2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.correct: Lets us edit the information for the assembly components

2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.question: The embedded 3D Viewer in Active Workspace can load an assembly:
options: Provided we have a high end workstation capable of rendering it
Even in cell phones or tablets, as it can use serverside rendering
No, it can only load single items
Provided all the components in the assembly have been released
2.5. Opening and viewing product structu.correct: Even in cell phones or tablets, as it can use serverside rendering

options: Will always load the information for the selected level on the left

Lets us view information for the assembly components, but not edit it
Opening and viewing product structures.correct: Lets us edit the information for the assembly components
